formal_accuser.name: Claudatte wife of Estienne Jean
formal_accuser.relationship_to_accused: Saw him at sabbat 22 years before

confession.seduction_context: Ill in bed at brother-in-law Didier du Treux's house in Fourchifol
sabbat_activities: feasting with bad meat without bread or salt

witnesses.name: Jean Gerard
witnesses.relationship_to_accused: Among richer taxpayers in same community

testimony.quarrel_subject: Father surcharged Jean on St. Remy tax levy
testimony.threat_quote: Father 'estoit cause de ce qu'il estoit remonté a ladite ayde Sainct Remy, mais qu'il n'y iroit plus pour la tirer'

testimony.quarrel_subject: Jean angry Gerard Jean Colin Gabourel bought property of Jean's sister
testimony.threat_quote: qu'il auroit la raison dudit Gerard de quelle sorte ce doibt estre

harms_alleged.target: Gerard Jean Colin Gabourel and his wife

witnesses.name: Demenge Didier Grand Colin jeune fils

testimony.quarrel_subject: Jean Colin Dieudonne went to fair without calling Jean as promised; Colas Demenge le Rouyer trespassed on Jean's land while ploughing
testimony.threat_quote: il avoit mal parlé d'user de telles menaces et que s'il arrivoit quelque fortune audit Colas ce seroit assez pour dire qu'il estoit sorcier

harms_alleged.target: Colas Demenge le Rouyer's finest ox

testimony.quarrel_subject: Dispute over fence erected between their land
testimony.threat_quote: qu'il luy ferolt ung desplaisir avant qu'il fut trois jours

harms_alleged.target: one of pair of oxen bought at Bruyeres fair

testimony.quarrel_subject: Accused Jean of encroaching on field with plough
Jean angry witness crossed his field

witnesses.name: Jean Clement
witnesses.relationship_to_accused: Both were servants at Lesseux 24 years before

witnesses.name: Gregoire Jean Don
witnesses.relationship_to_accused: Brother of Gerard Jean Don (witness 1's father)

testimony.quarrel_subject: His pigs strayed into Jean's garden

witnesses.name: Jean George Laulney
witnesses.relationship_to_accused: Cousin who sheltered Jean when he feared arrest

timeline.subject: Jean Blaise Laulney
timeline.details: Informations preparatoires taken by procureur d'office for chapter of St. Dié

timeline.subject: Jean Blaise Laulney
timeline.details: Confronted with Claudatte who maintains he was at sabbat 22 years before

timeline.subject: Jean Blaise Laulney
timeline.details: Procureur d'office asks for question extraordinaire

timeline.subject: Jean Blaise Laulney
timeline.details: Change de Nancy agrees to torture

timeline.subject: Jean Blaise Laulney
timeline.details: Racked and tortured; confessed after tourtillons applied

timeline.subject: Jean Blaise Laulney
timeline.details: Procureur asks for death sentence (strangled after feeling fire)

timeline.subject: Jean Blaise Laulney
timeline.details: Change de Nancy approves, subject to free confession in different place

timeline.subject: Jean Blaise Laulney
timeline.details: Addressed his claims that Virgin Mary appeared telling him to retract; confirmed confessions

accomplices_named.name: Claudatte wife of Estienne Jean
accomplices_named.context: Seen at sabbat; was formal accuser

accomplices_named.name: Dieudonne le Faye (or Dieudonne Jean Laurent)
Jehenne wife of maire Claude Martin
accomplices_named.context: Seen at sabbat; daughter of Jean Babey

accomplices_named.name: Demenge Mathis
accomplices_named.context: Seen at sabbat; added in later interrogation

prior_accusations.context: Jean served Jean Babey and reputation dates from this time; Babey executed 15 years before trial

notable_quotes.speaker: Jean Blaise Laulney
notable_quotes.french: qu'il ne le sauroit dire per ce qu'il ne l'a jamais sceu ny apprin et n'en scait que deux ou trois motz, qu'ung sien petit flls qu'il a mis a l'escolle, luy a apprin
notable_quotes.english: He could not say his Confiteor because he had never known or learned it, and only knew two or three words that his grandson who was at school had taught him
notable_quotes.context: When tortured and told to say Confiteor

notable_quotes.speaker: Jean Blaise Laulney
notable_quotes.french: pour l'honneur de dieu qu'on le tue sur le champ
notable_quotes.english: For the honor of God kill me on the spot

notable_quotes.speaker: Jean Blaise Laulney
notable_quotes.french: comme une meschante femme, et que sy nous luy faisons dire, nous le ferons dampner
notable_quotes.english: Like a wicked woman, and if we make her say it, we will damn her

notable_quotes.speaker: Jean Blaise Laulney to Vincent Demenge Laurent's sister
notable_quotes.french: if anyone spoke ill of him, even to a stone, he knew of it however far distant he was
notable_quotes.context: When courting witness's sister; boasting of supernatural knowledge

notable_quotes.speaker: Jean Blaise Laulney
notable_quotes.french: d'avoir pitié de sa femme et enfans
notable_quotes.english: To have pity on his wife and children

relationships.evidence_text: Had married a wife from last village 13 years before
his late brother Colas Blaise Laisney
his late father Gerard Jean Don

relationships.person1: Demenge Didier Grand Colin jeune fils

relationships.evidence_text: when he was in service of Jean Babey

economic_context.details: Multiple disputes over debts not paid to Jean, leading to alleged maleficia. Fence dispute with Demenge Mathieu. Property purchase dispute involving Gerard Jean Colin Gabourel. Tax levy dispute where Jean was among richer taxpayers ('les plus aisez') who were surcharged. Jean's concern about property confiscation if convicted.

harms_catalog.harm_description: Strange illness, languished miserably for 6 weeks, vomited black sticky matter after pear soup remedy
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Father surcharged Jean on St. Remy tax levy as he was among richer taxpayers
Vincent Jeandey had testified against Jean

harms_catalog.victim_name: Gerard Jean Colin Gabourel and his wife
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Jean angry because Gerard bought property of Jean's sister

harms_catalog.harm_description: Finest ox fell dead while at work
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Dieudonne went to Bruyeres fair without calling Jean as promised
Accused Jean of trespassing on his land while ploughing

harms_catalog.harm_description: Ox broke leg while ploughing, sold at great loss
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Dispute over fence between their land
Jean remarked horse not worth much and he would not keep it long
harms_catalog.time_between_quarrel_and_harm: within 2 or 3 days (began sickening), died weeks later

harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Jean threatened to give displeasure within 3 days after court case

harms_catalog.harm_description: Some pigs died after being kept in stable
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Jean warned him not to put animals in certain stable or he would have trouble

harms_catalog.harm_description: Fine ox sickened and died within an hour
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Accused Jean of encroaching on field with plough; called him a witch
His pigs strayed into Jean's garden

harms_catalog.harm_description: Became ill and died a few weeks later
harms_catalog.method_alleged: powder in wine at wedding feast

harms_catalog.harm_description: Became ill and died a few weeks later
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Had fined Jean for straying animals
harms_catalog.method_alleged: powder in wine at wedding feast

material_culture.context: Given by devil, used to kill animals and harm humans
Used in counter-magic soup remedy for Gerard Jean Don's illness
Powder placed in wine at wedding feast to poison two men
Dispute over fence erected between land
Taking grain to mill at St. Margaree
Jean warned Demenge Mathieu not to put animals in certain stable

spatial_references.context: Primary location of trial; residence of accused and most witnesses
Court location; Demenge Mathieu taken to court there
Location of tax levy; home of Jean Babey (executed witch)
Fair where Jean Colin Dieudonne bought oxen
Mill location; home of Jean's wife and former employer
Where Jean was living with brother-in-law when seduced by devil; site of wedding feast
Where Jean and Jean Clement were servants 24 years before
Where Jean served Bartremin; home of witness Jean Clement
Origin of man in black seen 20 years before
Where Jean confessed to attending sabbat with accomplices
Multiple quarrels over field boundaries and ploughing
Where Jean and witness putting water before dawn when black man appeared
Seat of appellate court (Change de Nancy)

officials_named.name: procureur d'office for chapter of St. Dié

prior_legal_disputes.description: Demenge Mathieu called Jean witch and was taken to court at St. Dié
prior_legal_disputes.outcome: Advised he lacked means to bring case and should make reparation

legal_context.imprisonment_conditions: Claimed Virgin Mary appeared to him in prison

change_de_nancy.modification_details: Approved death sentence subject to free confession in different place from torture location

hearsay_chains.content: Story of black man appearing before dawn when putting water into meadows

hearsay_chains.source: Didier Grand Colin and his son
hearsay_chains.content: Told him about Jean's threats regarding the ox

emotional_state_notes: shut eyes and mouth during torture
ready to die rather than confess falsely
begged to be killed on the spot during torture
said angel in white came to lead him to paradise when he lost consciousness
begged judges to have pity on wife and children
expressed regret about property confiscation and son's deprivation

reproaches_to_witnesses.objection: Reproached some witnesses with minor thefts
Jean Colin Dieudonne tried to rape his wife; did not prosecute out of pity for his children
Demenge Claude Colnot threatened to burn him in his house

third_parties.name: Jean Babey
third_parties.context: Executed witch from Mandray, 15 years before trial; Jean's reputation dated from serving him; Jean claimed to know when Babey went to see devil

third_parties.name: Jehenne (sister of witness 1)
third_parties.context: Mortally ill at time of trial; heard Jean threaten Vincent Jeandey

third_parties.name: Bartremin
third_parties.context: Of Remeymont; Jean was in his service

third_parties.name: Jean Aulbert
third_parties.context: Of Lesseu; Jean was in his service 24 years before

third_parties.name: Claude le Bailly
third_parties.context: Of St. Margaree; Jean was in his service

third_parties.name: Jean Colin Blaise
third_parties.context: Of St. Margaree; prisoner charged with witchcraft 10-18 years before; Jean frightened of arrest during this trial

third_parties.name: Didier du Treux
third_parties.context: Of Fourchifol; Jean living with him when seduced by devil; Jean confessed to poisoning him with powder in wine at wedding

third_parties.name: Demenge Andreu
third_parties.context: Jean confessed to poisoning him with powder in wine at wedding feast; had fined Jean for straying animals

third_parties.name: Claude Mengin
third_parties.context: Of Fourchifol; wedding feast 4 years before where Jean allegedly poisoned two men

third_parties.name: Colas Blaise Laisney
third_parties.context: Jean confessed to killing his brother's oxen with powder after being insulted

third_parties.name: Jacques Aulbert
third_parties.context: Brother of Jean Aulbert; employer of Jean Clement at Lesseux

third_parties.name: man in black
third_parties.context: From Frappel; appeared before dawn 20 years before when Jean was putting water in meadows

third_parties.name: grandson
third_parties.context: At school; taught Jean two or three words of Confiteor

third_parties.name: son
third_parties.context: Jean worried about him being deprived of property through confiscation

third_parties.name: three witches from Mandray
third_parties.context: Taken to St. Dié 7-8 years before; Jean terrified he would be arrested during this trial

extraction_metadata.notes: Complete trial record with detailed witness testimony, torture session, confessions, retractions, and execution. Notable for accused's illiteracy (could barely recite prayers), his initial resistance under torture, retraction claiming Virgin Mary appeared in prison, and concern about property confiscation affecting his son. Trial shows pattern of economic disputes (debts, taxes, property boundaries) preceding alleged maleficia. Strong evidence of torture-induced confession with standard sabbat narrative.
